alert.note: Alert for Ashland; Bayfield; Burnett; Douglas; Iron; Price; Sawyer; Washburn (Wisconsin) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Duluth (Northeast Minnesota and Northern Wisconsin)
info.headline: Winter Storm Watch issued December 20 at 6:33AM CST until December 24 at 12:00PM CST by NWS Duluth
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM WEDNESDAY AFTERNOON THROUGH SATURDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Blizzard conditions possible. Total snow accumulations of 6 to 11 inches, except 13 to 17 inches for northern Iron county possible. Winds could gust as high as 40 mph. * WHERE...Douglas, Bayfield, Ashland, Iron, Burnett, Washburn, Sawyer and Price Counties. This includes the Tribal Lands of the Lac Courte Oreilles Reservation, the Red Cliff Band and the Bad River Reservation. * WHEN...From Wednesday afternoon through Saturday morning. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult to impossible. Areas of blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. The hazardous conditions could impact the morning or evening commute. The cold wind chills as low as 30 below zero could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 30 minutes. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Snow loading on trees from the past storm in combination with the high winds may cause heavy tree damage resulting in widespread power outages in cold weather. Blizzard conditions are possible.
info.instruction: Prepare for possible blizzard conditions late this week. Continue to monitor the latest forecasts for updates on this situation.

area.areaDesc: Ashland; Bayfield; Burnett; Douglas; Iron; Price; Sawyer; Washburn
